posts.cooked:
Hello everyone,

I was having some issue with vision localization being completely off which I did fix for the most part. Now, the y value is almost perfect, but my x value is constantly around 20 cm off. I have tried changing the vision stddevs for the pose estimator, swapping x/y values signs for the camera transformations, inverting the yaw for the tag → camera transformation, etc. The calibration/distortion matrices are correct for solvePnP.

Is this normal? Should I add a default x-offset to the vision pose? Is this normal with only one tag in sight?

Thank you in advance for your insight.

posts.name: Sam
posts.cooked: This seems like it would most likely be incorrect field tag positioning causing this. Does it happen only in the X direction, even with an AprilTag turned 90 degrees like the amp? It does not seem normal to me, but you shouldn’t need to add any offset.
I was actually testing this on the amp and speaker. The results are similar, though with the amp I think the x was slightly better. The y is perfect, it only happens in the x directions.

posts.name: Dan Langdon
posts.cooked: Do you have your camera to robot distances right?  We had an issue where our programmer had mixed these up.
They might be off by a cm ot two, but they are correct. Got them from the cad and made sure coord system was adjusted

Wait, quick question, do we have to factor in gyro offsets when doing visions or should it not be affected if the gyro already has its offset set?  Because then it would be around that far off in the x.

posts.name: Adithya Anand
posts.cooked:
There could be a multitude of reasons where this can happen. First off, like @woodworker2001 said, double checking offsets is always a good start. I would also try and check the angle offsets with that, as we have had some times where the camera mounts were a few degrees off from what they should have been, which threw off pose by at least a foot or 2.

In terms of offsets, gyro does not affect vision in any way. Your vision offsets should be from the camera lens to the floor under the center of the robot.

Hmm. I guess I should check the camera degree offsets, since those may be a couple degrees offset just based on not perfect attachment. I did not know a couple degrees could throw it off so much. Will check on the angle offset on Monday. Thanks for the detailed insight.

posts.name: Kevin Forbes
posts.cooked:
Are you using a Limelight?

Not sure about x, but we discovered the field width (y) is only 8.0m in the Limelight’s model and about 8.2m in WPIlib (which matches the field drawing).

Notice the MegaTag BotPoseBlue y position in images below, it should be 5.54m IIRC. We add 0.1m to Limelight value to correct for this, since the origin is offset.

PXL_20240402_030644449 1920×1446 163 KB PXL_20240402_030652232 1920×1446 442 KB PXL_20240402_030823406 1920×1446 173 KB

PXL_20240402_030644449 1920×1446 163 KB

PXL_20240402_030644449 1920×1446 163 KB

PXL_20240402_030652232 1920×1446 442 KB

PXL_20240402_030652232 1920×1446 442 KB

PXL_20240402_030823406 1920×1446 173 KB

PXL_20240402_030823406 1920×1446 173 KB

posts.name: Jason Daming
posts.cooked:
TheOtherGuy:

Not sure about x, but we discovered the field width (y) is only 8.0m in the Limelight’s model

This is a very interesting claim. How did you come to that conclusion?
I am using an rpi4 with lifecams, so the 8m vs 8.2 m shouldn’t be the issue. That is very interesting though. I guess I can try to add 0.2 m to x if nothing else works.

posts.name: Kevin Forbes
posts.cooked: As I understand it, the Limelight internally uses a coordinate system centered on the middle of the field. If you place the robot somewhere centered ( podium , for example), the reported BotPose TY is 0m, while the BotPoseBlue is 4.0m. You can see the same offset in the image I posted above, where BotPose says the robot is at TY=1.43, but BotPoseBlue claims TY=5.43. BotPoseRed TY (5.43) plus BotPoseBlue TY (2.58) also adds to 8.0m.

Yeah, I tested it out and it did not work that well even after fenagling some camera transforms. Did manage to get it to fluctuate around the proper value, but it still ends up being unusable. It looks like I have issues with the my transformations to be honest, so I’m going to review those.
